excerpt:
In the face of daunting global challenges, such as climate change and a catastrophic pandemic, it is evident that the world urgently needs science-based solutions to tackle society’s greatest problems.

At the University of California, Berkeley, the next generation of emerging scholars and entrepreneurs will work to confront those challenges in the [Bakar](https://bioenginuityhub.berkeley.edu/) [BioEnginuity](https://bioenginuityhub.berkeley.edu/) [Hub (BBH)](https://bioenginuityhub.berkeley.edu/), a new campus initiative that aims to launch the world-changing startups of today, while cultivating the innovative leaders of tomorrow. These innovators can launch their startups at BBH’s [Bakar Labs](https://bakarlabs.berkeley.edu/), a world-class incubator open to teams from around the world — a space where anyone can leverage all that Berkeley has to offer.
author: Ivan Natividad
title: Bakar BioEnginuity Hub: Berkeley’s bold new home for innovation, entrepreneurship
